New Records: Anthony Edwards scored 28 of his 37 points in the second half, including a career-high 53 points in Saturday’s loss at Detroit, and finished 14 of 29 from the field, including a pair of late 3-pointers for his eighth game this season of 30-plus points.
Key Match Events: Edwards swished a step-back 3 with 1:12 to play, and then drained another 3 with 34.4 seconds left for a 106-101 lead
The Clippers led 96-91 with 4:07 to go, but a three-point play and a 3 by Edwards put the Timberwolves up by one a minute later
Pre-Game Insights: In his second game back after missing the team’s first 34 while recovering from a right knee injury, Kawhi Leonard scored eight points on 3-of-11 shooting
Mike Conley came off the bench for the first time in his 131 games with the Timberwolves, and finished with 11 points
Post-Match Reflections: The Timberwolves ended a three-game slide
The Clippers have lost three of four
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rudy Gobert had eight points and a game-high 18 rebounds
Norman Powell led Los Angeles with 25 points, James Harden added 22 and Ivica Zubac had 17 points and 16 rebounds
Others: The Clippers are at Denver on Wednesday. The Timberwolves are at New Orleans on Tuesday
